# to instal phyloseq
```{r}
if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")

BiocManager::install("phyloseq")
```

# load the packages
```{r}
library(phyloseq)
library(dplyr)
library(BiMiCo)
library(ggplot2)
library(devtools)
library(MicEco)
library(vegan)
```

# load taxa and seqtab.nochim
```{r}
load("RData/taxa.RData")
load("RData/seqtab.nochim.RData")
```

# import metadat
```{r}
metadata<-read.csv("metadata.csv", header=TRUE, row.names=1)
```

# create phyloseq object
```{r}
# make sure the seqtab.nochim and taxa objects are loaded
physeq=phyloseq(otu_table(seqtab.nochim, taxa_are_rows=FALSE), sample_data(metadata), tax_table(taxa))
physeq
```

# remove the sequence itself and replace with ASV
```{r}
dna=Biostrings::DNAStringSet(taxa_names(physeq))
names(dna)=taxa_names(physeq)
physeq=merge_phyloseq(physeq,dna)
taxa_names(physeq)=paste0("ASV", seq(ntaxa(physeq)))
physeq
```

# remove mitochondria and chloroplast matches, remove all non bacterial sequences
```{r}
physeq=physeq%>%subset_taxa(Family!="Mitochondria" | is.na(Family) &
Order!="Chloroplast" | is.na(Order))
physeq
```

# removes all non bacterial sequences
```{r}
physeq=rm_nonbac(physeq)
physeq
```

# instal another package to run the above code
```{r}
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("peterolah001/BiMiCo")
```

# save physeq objet to load later
```{r}
save(physeq,file="RData/physeq.RData")
```

# load physeq objects to start here
```{r}
load("RData/physeq.RData")
```

# plot the grpah based on phylum
```{r}
plot_bar(physeq, fill = "Phylum") +
geom_bar(aes(color=Phylum,fill=Phylum),stat="identity", position="fill")
```

# if you dont have ggplot 2, i already have mine
```{r}
install.packages("ggplot2")
```

# create a barplot of relative abundance
```{r}
# convert to relative abundance
physeq_relabund=transform_sample_counts(physeq, function(x) x / sum(x))

# barplot
plot_bar(physeq_relabund,fill = "Phylum") + 
geom_bar(aes(color=Phylum,fill=Phylum),stat="identity",position="fill")+facet_wrap(~body.site,scales="free")
```

# plot alpha diversity based on body size
```{r}
plot_richness(physeq, x="body.site", color="subject",
measures=c("Observed", "Simpson", "Shannon"))
```

# plot alpha diversity based on reported.antibiotic.usage
```{r}
plot_richness(physeq, x="reported.antibiotic.usage", color="body.site",
measures=c("Observed", "Simpson", "Shannon"))
```

# plot alpha diversity based on subject
```{r}
plot_richness(physeq, x="subject", color="body.site",
measures=c("Observed", "Simpson", "Shannon"))
```

# test for normality
```{r}
alpha <- estimate_richness(physeq, measures=c("Observed", "Simpson", "Shannon"))
```

# strain
```{r}
observed <- shapiro.test(alpha$Observed)
shannon <- shapiro.test(alpha$Shannon)
simpson <- shapiro.test(alpha$Simpson)

print(observed)
print(shannon)
print(simpson)
```

# create data frames for statistical analyses
```{r}
# extracts samples information from the physeq object
samples=sample_data(physeq)

```

# if samples is a phyloseq sample_data, convert it to a data fram
```{r}
if (class(sample) =="sample_data") {samples=data.frame(sample_data(samples))
}

```

```{r}
# add a column to alpha with sample names
alpha$sample=rownames(alpha)

```

```{r}
# merge alpha diversity data and sample data
alpha=merge(alpha, samples, by ="sample")
```

# perform statistics based on subject
```{r}
# perform willcox test
test_observed=willcox.test(Observed ~ subject, data=alpha)
test_simpson=willcox.test(Simpson ~ subject, data=alpha)
test_shannon=willcox.test(Shannon ~ subject, data=alpha)

# printing the results
print(test_observed)
print(test_simpson)
print(test_shannon)
```

# perform statistics based on reported.antibiotic.usage
```{r}
# perform willcox test
test_observed=willcox.test(Observed ~ reported.antibiotic.usage, data=alpha)
test_simpson=willcox.test(Simpson ~ reported.antibiotic.usage, data=alpha)
test_shannon=willcox.test(Shannon ~ reported.antibiotic.usage, data=alpha)

# printing the results
print(test_observed)
print(test_simpson)
print(test_shannon)
```

# test for body size
```{r}
kruskal.test(Simpson~body.site,data=alpha)
pairwise.wilcox.test(alpha$Simpson,alpha$body.site,p.adjust.method = "holm")
kruskal.test(Observed~body.site,data=alpha)
pairwise.wilcox.test(alpha$Observed,alpha$body.site,p.adjust.method = "holm")
shannonanova=aov(Shannon~body.site,data=alpha)
summary(shannonanova)
TukeyHSD(shannonanova)
```

# remove taxa with relative abundance <0.005%
```{r}
minTotReAlbun=0.00005
x=taxa_sums(physeq)
keepTaxa=(x/sum(x)) > minTotReAlbun
physeqprune=prune_taxa(keepTaxa,physeq)
physeqprune
```

# number of shared ASVs body.site (found in 25% or more)
```{r}
bodysite=ps_venn(
  physeqprune,
  "body.site",
  fraction=.25,
  weight=FALSE,
  relative=TRUE,
  plot=TRUE
)
bodysite
```

# to instal the package to run the code above (insert into console, and add this to library codes)
```{r}
install.packages("devtools")
install_github("Russel88/MicEco")
```

# Bray Curtis calculation
```{r message=FALSE}
set.seed(777)
dist=phyloseq::distance(physeqprune,method="bray", weighted=TRUE)
ordination=ordinate(physeqprune,method="NMDS",distance=dist)
```

# Bray Curtis Subject Plot
```{r}
braysubject=plot_ordination(physeqprune,ordination,color="subject") +
  theme_classic()+
  theme(strip.background=element_blank())+stat_ellipse(aes(group=subject))
braysubject
```

# Bray Curtis Body Site Plot (switch all words from "subject" to "body.site")
```{r}
brayabusage=plot_ordination(physeqprune,ordination,color="reported.antibiotic.usage")+
  theme_classic()+
  theme(strip.background = element_blank())+
  stat_ellipse(aes(group=reported.antibiotic.usage))

brayabusage
```

# Bray Curtis Antibiotics Usage Plot (switch all words from "body.site" to "reported.antibiotic. usage")
```{r}
brayabusage=plot_ordination(physeqprune,ordination,color="reported.antibiotic.usage")+
  theme_classic()+
  theme(strip.background = element_blank())+
  stat_ellipse(aes(group=reported.antibiotic.usage))
```

# Bray Curtis Subject Statistics
```{r}
adonis2/dist~sample_data(physeqpure)(subject)
```

# install this package for the above code
```{r}
install.packages("vegan")
```

# Bray Curtis Body Site Statistics
```{r}
adonis2(dist~sample_data(physeqprune)$body.site)
ps.disper=betadisper(dist,sample_data(physeqprune)$body.site)
permutest(ps.disper,pair=TRUE)
```

# Bray Curtis Antibiotic Usage Satitstics
```{r}
adonis2(dist~sample_data(physeqprune)$reported.antibiotic.usage)
```
